content:
So I was working along on some code today and ran into todo! macro impl return.

fn blah() -> impl Iterator<Item = ()> {
    panic!()
}

a. Is there more info about this in other issues, I had a hard time finding more issues.

b. Can this be solved in some way. Can the never type (!) be special cased in to impl traits when it needs to as long as we just panic? Or does this create soundness holes or the like.
I found https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/69882 which has a bunch of links and related stuff.
